column4: How can I enable real time transparency in 10.04? Windows and the whole thing
uhmm
there was going to be a transparant feature, but thats been delayed untill 10.10
my specs will handle it perfectly. damn it
so i need to wait until 10.10 to get some real time transparency? not cool, not cool at all
you mean the RGB or whatever it was called thing yeah?
yes, something like that. i want real god damn transparency without any pseudo transparency. my specs can handle it.
but not a problem, will wait for 10.10 then :)
yeah except
whatever 10.10 has for this will probably be quite basic
needed to remind me of a "g... dam..." ? lol
anyway in the mean time, you can make your panels transparant
yes, that is good idea. panels as transparent will be useful.
and with the default theme, the terminal has a transparant effect as well
i set the transparency on the terminal already.
if you make the panels big,  with transparant effect, that can be fun, since then you can see through to the background
and you can put one on the left and right even  just for this, but auto hide, or they take up way to much space
and Compiz has transparant effects I think
sure, i can try that out. it seems like the transparency is rather good but icons really need to be bigger.
compiz was actually quite good as well. did not find though the transparency settings i was looking for though.
I don't tend to use Compiz, but I think it can do it
may need the advanced settings manager
i think my specs would be able to handle full transparency all the way around. not sure too
thanks for your kind help :)
